dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Strauss c Shakib Al Hasan b Rubel Hossain 154 (140b 16x4 5x6 201m) SR: 110

dismissalComment.html: Strauss falls now, but what an innings it's been! 154 from 140 balls, he's been threatening all summer in one-day cricket, looking in sublime touch without making the big score, this time he's really done his job. In the end he sliced an attempted cover drive in the air where deep point held on

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Jonathan Trott c Shakib Al Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza 110 (121b 12x4 0x6 169m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: good catch! Trott falls but it's been a fantastic knock, England were nervy when he came to the crease at 1 for 1, but he leaves them in utter control. It was full and Trott mowed it towards straightish midwicket where Shakib moved sharply to his right and held on to a tough chance

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe strikes! Kieswetter falls again, Kieswetter bowled again! Massive start for Bangladesh! It was full and nipping back, Kieswetter as usual staying leg side of the ball an it got an inside edge and flew through a gaping space between bat and pad on to the stumps!

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Yardy 42 (81b 4x4 0x6 90m) SR: 51.85

dismissalComment.html: he's given him! Mahmudullah's vigil at the crease comes to an end as Yardy strikes him on the pad. Huge appeal, and the umpire gives him out lbw. Unluckily, it must be said, as the ball was sliding down the leg side. So that eighth wicket partnership record remains...

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c Bresnan b Bopara 27 (33b 3x4 0x6 63m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: another one goes! Razzak slashes a full, wide ball out to Bresnan at deep cover. Just one wicket needed now

headshotImage.caption: RS Bopara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RS Bopara headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Bopara strikes with his third ball! That was absolutely plumb, Bopara pulled the length back slightly and got the ball to jag in off the seam to strike Ashraful right infront of middle and leg. There was no issue with height, either, as the ball had kept slightly low. Oh dear. Bangladesh sink even further

headshotImage.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza headshot

dismissalComment.html: well, good shot last ball, but an airy waft to the next one leads to his downfall. Bopara pulled the length back and also found some movement away from the bat. Mashrafe, who had been beaten several times on the cut already, finally gets bat on one, and Kieswetter clings on to the thick edge

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another one goes! Razzak slashes a full, wide ball out to Bresnan at deep cover. Just one wicket needed now

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Bopara ends the game! Shafiul almost swings himself off his feet as Bopara sends one down full and straight. His head is in the air, his eyes, presumably, closed, and he doesn't get close to it. The stumps are disturbed and that's that.

headshotImage.caption: Ajmal Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajmal Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's the wicket that England wanted, Tamim falls in pursuit of quick runs. It was a slower ball, very full and Tamim tried to smash it over long-off. But he just got underneath it, and the fielder at mid-off circled underneath the steepling chance. Big breakthrough for England, do Bangladesh have the fight in them to keep up the attack without their star batsman?

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad is pumped up now! It was another fiery short ball, on the off side this time and Kayes couldn't get the glove out of the way in time as the ball rose up at him. A little touch on the ball as it went through, and Kieswetter does the rest. Two down now, and one can feel the fight going from Bangladesh now.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Collingwood/†Kieswetter) 6 (19b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 31.57

dismissalComment.html: oh dear. Chaos here and Shakib has gone. This looks pretty grim. It was a no ball, Ashraful worked it round the corner, scampered one, looked certain to be coming back for a second as he set off, calling Shakib though, but then Ashraful changed his mind, leaving Shakib stranded midpitch as Collingwood, on all fours, had time to take the bails off

commentTextItems.html: Bopara ends the game! Shafiul almost swings himself off his feet as Bopara sends one down full and straight. His head is in the air, his eyes, presumably, closed, and he doesn't get close to it. The stumps are disturbed and that's that.

commentPostTextItems.html: England's biggest victory margin in terms of runs since the game between these two teams at Trent Bridge in 2005, when Strauss got his previous high-score and Collingwood took a six-for. A convincing win, to say the least. It appeared we had a game on when Kieswetter was castled in the very first over, but once Strauss and Trott came together England regained control and they never really let go, despite the loss of wickets at the end of the innings. The fight went out of Bangladesh as soon as Tamim departed, and the game was over as a competition from about the 20th over of Bangladesh's innings. Read all about it in Andrew Miller's match bulletin.

"We bowled very poorly," says Mashrafe. "It's difficult to say why. We didn't put the ball in the right areas this morning. We have to play well against Ireland and Scotland and win those matches so we can get some confidence back. We won a game in England so we should win those games."

Andrew Strauss is Man of the Match and Man of the Series for the runs he's scored and the way in which he's scored them. "A good way to bounce back after Bristol," he says. "We were disappointed with our performance there and wanted to put it right today... I've been hitting the ball really well throughout the one-dayers, got a few fifties but haven't gone on to any big scores until today. It goes to show, even at this aging stage of my career you can still expand your game... A few guys have come in and put their names in the hat in this series. You need more than 11 players to win a lot of series and certainly to win the World Cup."

That's all from your commentary team - Liam Brickhill and Sahil Dutta - for today. Thanks for joining us, and please come back for Cricinfo's coverage of the first Test between Australia and Pakistan at Lord's, which starts tomorrow. Until then, it's goodbye!

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's the wicket that England wanted, Tamim falls in pursuit of quick runs. It was a slower ball, very full and Tamim tried to smash it over long-off. Big breakthrough for England, do Bangladesh have the fight in them to keep up the attack without their star batsman?

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful lbw b Bopara 13 (19b 0x4 1x6 28m) SR: 68.42

dismissalComment.html: gone! Bopara strikes with his third ball! That was absolutely plumb, Bopara pulled the length back slightly and got the ball to jag in off the seam to strike Ashraful right infront of middle and leg. There was no issue with height, either, as the ball had kept slightly low. Oh dear. Bangladesh sink even further

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Yardy 42 (81b 4x4 0x6 90m) SR: 51.85

dismissalComment.html: he's given him! Mahmudullah's vigil at the crease comes to an end as Yardy strikes him on the pad. Huge appeal, and the umpire gives him out lbw. Unluckily, it must be said, as the ball was sliding down the leg side. So that eighth wicket partnership record remains...

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c †Kieswetter b Bopara 14 (17b 3x4 0x6 16m) SR: 82.35

dismissalComment.html: well, good shot last ball, but an airy waft to the next one leads to his downfall. Bopara pulled the length back and also found some movement away from the bat. Mashrafe, who had been beaten several times on the cut already, finally gets bat on one, and Kieswetter clings on to the thick edge

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiul Islam b Bopara 16 (12b 1x4 1x6 10m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Bopara ends the game! Shafiul almost swings himself off his feet as Bopara sends one down full and straight. His head is in the air, his eyes, presumably, closed, and he doesn't get close to it. The stumps are disturbed and that's that.

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajmal Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's the wicket that England wanted, Tamim falls in pursuit of quick runs. It was a slower ball, very full and Tamim tried to smash it over long-off. But he just got underneath it, and the fielder at mid-off circled underneath the steepling chance. Big breakthrough for England, do Bangladesh have the fight in them to keep up the attack without their star batsman?

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad is pumped up now! It was another fiery short ball, on the off side this time and Kayes couldn't get the glove out of the way in time as the ball rose up at him. A little touch on the ball as it went through, and Kieswetter does the rest. Two down now, and one can feel the fight going from Bangladesh now.

dismissalComment.html: good catch Luke Wright! Slower ball from Bresnan, Siddique flicked it hard, looking to clear mid on but Wright moved swiftly to his left and held on to the chance above his head. Another one down for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Collingwood/†Kieswetter) 6 (19b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 31.57

dismissalComment.html: oh dear. Chaos here and Shakib has gone. This looks pretty grim. It was a no ball, Ashraful worked it round the corner, scampered one, looked certain to be coming back for a second as he set off, calling Shakib though, but then Ashraful changed his mind, leaving Shakib stranded midpitch as Collingwood, on all fours, had time to take the bails off

milestones.description: Strauss and Trott's 250-run partnership is ENG's highest for the 2nd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 202 between Graham Gooch and David Gower
Shafiul Islam has conceded the most runs in an innings (97) in ODIs for BAN, going past Shafiul Islam's record of 95
Strauss and Trott's 250-run partnership is ENG's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 226 between Strauss and Flintoff
